ratings.question_text: How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-10, if you wish
comments: I would have liked more focus on skill-building with regards to green criteria, as opposed to the focus on the design process. I have gotten design training elsewhere, but I would have liked to have gone deeper into the chemistry, the LCA work, materials choices, etc. etc.
The chance to apply our learning to a fun semester-long project
The final project. It was a great way (and fun way!) to exercise the skill set we learned throughout the semester.
Group work.
The emphasis on thinking about problems in a different way.

narratives.question_text: The things about this course most in need of improvement are:
comments: I felt like I got exposure to a bunch of cool concepts in this course, but didn't build a ton of new skills in areas where I would have liked to have gone deeper (see my response to question 11)
The problem sets were very time consuming, in particular, problem set 3. It might be worth splitting that one up in two.

The homeworks were laborious and too long. There was a lot of just summarizing or copying from readings or lecture. The time it took to do those things took away from the more abstract or quantitative questions and the time I could spend focusing on the concepts they required.

narratives.question_text: What was the availability and quality of help you received of the instructor and TA?
comments: Both the instructor and the TAs always gave thoughtful and prompt responses to our questions -- we really appreciated that
Excellent - especially for the problem sets and final project.
Very good-TA.
Excellent. Julie and the TAs were great and responsive.

narratives.question_text: Discuss if you wish how this course fits into your overall program.
comments: I'm interested in corporations offering green consumables so this class helped to gain the design perspective needed.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: To better understand how I might push businesses to design away environmentally negative aspects of their products from the start, rather than forcing us to deal with the consequences of bad decisions later
Students who took the course last year said it was one of the more valuable courses they had taken at FES in terms of skill sets learned and recommended I take it.
I love design.

narratives.question_text: Did it live up to your expectations?
comments: Somewhat -- I'd say I added some conceptual tools to my toolbox, but I would have liked more skills that I feel I could go out and deploy confidently
Yes.
Yes, it did.
Yes

narratives.question_text: Did you get out of it what you expected?
comments: Yes and no -- I think in addition to some of the qualitative learning I took away from the class, I would have liked some more quantitative tools
Yes.
Yes

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: Group work was critical to our design process, and I was very glad to work with my peers in a thoughtful, semester-long effort to come up with a cool product. My whole team added value, and I wouldn't have wanted to do the exercise without them. No disadvantages, to my mind
None - we had agreat experience!
It was great.

narratives.question_text: For students taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: As the class is currently structured, consider it an intro to design with a green angle, rather than a class geared for those who--first and foremost--want to build skills in analyzing the environmentally friendliness or harmfulness of products
Start the problem sets early and leave enough time to design and make your project product.
Just take it, you won't regret!
